JQM_TNiwU_aMBSiUpKZGIw.text: Eva is the best bartender! I have had the best time sitting at her bar! And her cucumber margarita is to die for!  She needs a raise and has awesome ideas for the menu!! I will be back!!!!! :-)

sBQ34sYUv0QRWtpZUyjJXA.text: The service was great we had a older gentlemen I didn't catch his name but he was very helpful and pleasant. The food was pretty good well worth going back a second time we are even planning on bring my sister and her family here. The only thing I didn't like was the fact the young hostess dress top was COMPLETELY see threw. With the men diners that may be great but it is a family friendly and I would not like bring my kids here. It was shocking. When I say see threw I mean I could tell size color and style of bra.

Qxu174a9ZgDSDZSIUYd6Eg.text: You could find a crappy Mexican restaurant like this anywhere in America. Uninteresting menu, slow service, bad decor. The flies would not stay off of our bland enchiladas, so at least THEY enjoyed them. If you want to know what Mexican restaurants were like thirty years ago, you can't do much better than this  relic from a flavorless past.

YQvc9dgn9hawY_RFQO74BQ.text: Everything was amazing. Soups, margaritas and dinner! Simply fresh and best Mexican food ever!

hsSMsGgzvsgn0O8B0Pt7tg.text: Food was delicious. The sauces and bean dip were on point. The margaritas were ok but the overall experience was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MEOPcvoc6LY8E08v8LcqVg.text: My favorite Mexican Restaurant in Las Vegas!! I always order the Chilaquiles. My husband and I are Mexican and a little picky of where we eat our Mexican food. This place is our spot!. My 4year old loves it and we get a complimentary photo to take with us, so I have plenty of photos of myself with my family. We get great service and if we want anything special for my 4year old they always accommodate.  I didn't give them a 5 star only because the parking...well it sux to find a good parking spot, however the car shop behind them are very kind and will let us park in their business parking lot.

vjRmvq6iA8o5yQxOZG_40Q.text: Possibly the worse service I have ever had. We were seated the young girl asked if we wanted to start with a guacamole dip we said yes, it never came. Had the server pass us more than a few times wouldn't even make eye contact. Finally get to order my husband orders their shrimp burrito I asked If it came with a good amount of shrimp if not to add extra (we didn't care to pay the extra price) he said that it was a good portion so we took his word. I ordered the cheese enchiladas which didn't taste too bad except the fact that they were cold. I asked for some tortillas on the side for my daughter he brought out the hardest tortillas ever! So hard my daughter choked on it. I guess the only good thing I can say is that our food came out fast. But I don't see how much time they needed to roll a few tortillas and smack them on a plate. (The burrito was literally the only thing on the plate) no sides no nothing. I will for sure never come back or recommend this place to anyone! Thanks for nothing. Besides a 60$ bill for bad everything!

Dxz-EVmuOECthqbTpqAhJw.text: This is coming from a Mexican, the place has a lot of different dishes for everyone (vegetarian, pork, chicken, seafood) and it may take you a bit to choose a dish! It gets very busy during lunch hour, so I recommend making a reservation or arriving early. The chips and tortillas are all fresh and they do have spicy plates as well!  And being a Frida Kahlo fan, I LOVE eating right by the wall that's full of her greatness!  This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants. I wish I lived closer to this great restaruant! :)  LOL, I recommend ignoring reviews from SoCal people. They're Mexican food spoiled over there and just love to bash LV Mexican places. :P

BO-z0hv29jFfG1Y71eSVNQ.text: The food was excellent and well prepared. The hard tortilla shells for the tacos were fried tortilla's instead of the prepackaged corn chip shells. The service was outstanding. Billy G and crew were very attentive and very well mannered. This will certainly be a dining destination anytime we are in the Las Vegas area.

BVZbCSdwOS_O4sHO-Jxl7g.text: Always love this place..  Great service, price and atmosphere.. Guacamole is incredible.

oy0xHteZisXCbb4wTLBMlw.text: In the middle of countless furniture stores, bail bonds, and some thrift shops on Main Street sits this restaurant with really good Mexican food. Very pretty inside! I love the atmosphere. The servers are wearing the outfits to match the festive interior. The service is pretty good. There is street parking with meters (quarters) and there is a  parking lot in the back of the restaurant. For First Friday, they set up seating on the sidewalk.  You get chips & salsa (yummy)- guacamole is  extra. I always get the fish tacos here, which are really good, and good sized, too. In fact, I don't think that I've ever veered away from the fish tacos (and I've been coming here for years now). My husband always gets the beef burrito here.  Prices are reasonable. Participates in the Entertainment Book. I would recommend this restaurant.

s_s-PDFLnQUlWH2xMihgQw.text: The food was fantastic. Drinks amazing, Gabby is the best bar tender. Our server Javier was amazing.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

8Lt1lAt49pPe9TK-Mhh_Qg.text: This place is super convenient to work, so we come over often for celebrations. What I enjoy the most is how beautifully decorated and colorful the restaurant is. I am a huge Frida Kahlo fan and they have a her art and photographs all over the restaurant. The atmosphere is lively and fun. You can't help but find yourself in a good mood while dining here.   The menu is huge and includes everything's you can think of in terms of Mexican food. I really enjoy the flautas, enchiladas, menudo and the Fideo! Food is consistent but not incredible. The margarita's are really tasty though so I would recommend the mango margarita when you stop in.   One of my coolest experiences at this restaurant was when an all women mariachi band played for Mexican Independence Day! These ladies were simple amazing and oh so talented. I happened to be dining there on this day and was lucky enough to get to see them.   If you are looking for reasonably priced dining in the downtown area then this place is worth a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flauntas!
Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Salad!

bYDxQ85dW9W8k9mx-7D9ug.text: By chance we were going to the outlets looked left and saw this Mexican Cuisine stop .. wow food was authentic all the way to grandma making homemade tortillas in the corner ... no joke! The food was piping hot and very tasty. Service was outstanding and quick and polite. Big menu to choose from so this is a great stop!

xCshVFFH3MKGLO9tiUf3HQ.text: Some great home style mexican food that makes you forget you are out of town!!! Food...A Service-Ivan...A Atmosphere-A PRICE-A+

9AhVohbPExmXq-pm3JGLAQ.text: From the moment you walk in you are transported to Mexico.  The decor is awesome and the staff is friendly and fast.   The salsa is mild so don't expect a kick. The entire menu is on the mild side. Perfect for first timers or those scared of heat.   The food is decent for mainstream Mexican. I love the combination dishes myself. A little of this a little of that.  I would definitely recommend this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another happy customer.  Had to have some &#34;Lita&#39;s&#34; rice.

GGIhj9HVPK5OwAD9Hu1Z5w.text: Sizzling fajitas are a must! The portions are huge for the price so you could probably split them. I typically order shrimp and let me tell you, they do not skimp on the meat! My other favorite dish is their fajita salad and I LOVE the sweet tamale [drool emoji]. I originally tried this place because my friend's family runs it and it's a convenient distance from my work. I have to say I've scored. On top of that their service is wonderful from the second you come in the door. I've always had a great experience but this round Ivan was an absolute pleasure to have as server.   Local recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fajitas piled high
Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cadillac margarita
Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of many specials

2O7nRQogPM-xpKcmaHDV_w.text: Garlic shrimp was OK, but the shredded beef tacos were awesome!  Great service and reasonable price, The reason we keep coming back.

5WHVXwJ1pWLppdh0LBADqA.text: Loved this restaurant!  Very authentic Mexican food. The guacamole, queso fundido, and refried beans are A+.  So much food and all of it was delicious!  Come here and enjoy the atmosphere and the fabulous food!

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FEiRjLNyIV0GtJ6TXKFW2Q.text: Really good fajitas. Excellent service, fun atmosphere. They had a house photographer to take a souvenir picture.

aKw_KpxlonH9P5ZvLGvc8g.text: This place is a JOKE! Unless you want to be ignored by the entire staff on a slow day, go somewhere else. My daughter and I were visiting the surrounding vintage shops when we decided to stop in for some drinks and a quick bite. We walked into a pretty slow restaurant with about 5-6 tables occupied. Based on this, we figured it would be pretty quick service. We stood at the hostess booth for quite a while and although there were about 5 workers standing around us talking to each other, no one bothered to greet or even look at us.  After about 5 minutes, the actual hostess came up and asked "how many?" No "sorry about the wait, hello, how's your day, welcome...nothing. Just "how many". Being the type of person that tries to see situations from all points of view, I quickly chalked it up to maybe just an off day..nothing to get upset over, besides, it was 115 outside, I was just happy to be in from the heat and was looking forward to a cold drink and delicious food. We were sat down at a booth and given our menus along with some delicious chips, beans and salsa. After about 10 minutes, we began to wonder when the waiter would come back to deliver some water and take our order. Well he didn't. It was like we were invisible. Keep in mind, at no time while we were there was there more than 6 tables occupied. The waiter assigned to the tables across us continued to service his tables without even looking over to us. I attempted to flag him down a couple of times but it was like he refused to turn our way. Getting a little frustrated at about the 30 minute mark, my daughters and I decided that we'd  leave only if a newly sat customer was serviced before us and unfortunately, that happened. A full half our after we were seated in a booth and abandoned, another customer was seated across us and serviced with water, drinks and order taken.  So we stood up and left. Not one of the 3 employees on our way out said anything to us. They barely even looked at us to be honest. I made a stop at the hostess desk on my way out and said "you sat us about a half hour ago and we couldn't even get water...a new table was just seated and are enjoying drinks and ordering at this very moment, that's inexcusable. You know what she said as I walked away? "Have a nice day!" I have never ever in all my life gone to a restaurant and been blatantly ignored and treated like I didn't matter. There has to literally be thousands of Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas...don't waste your time here like I did.  Casa Don Juan Downtown...get your $#!! together.

CeYDGfS1L-3iyNgYfeUZJA.text: Placed an order to go of there taquitos but I told them I only wanted the taquitos I didn't want a meal with rice and beans, I want a la cart style. I sent my assistant to pick up my lunch and they charged me over $12.00 for 4 taquitos. My assistant told them they shouldn't charge that much and she was told by the cashier that she only knows how to charge it by the lunch menu and just told the kitchen not to add rice and beans and she did not know how to charge for just taquitos. I had to go back myself and explain what I was trying to order, finally a manager came up and told the cashier to charge the taquito appetizer because I didn't want a meal. Not sure why she didn't do that in the first place. Not going back there ever again, they weren't even that good of taquitos, very oily.

0J5uQoUaB2dAcn_O6LfUwQ.text: The food and service was awesome. Alex is such an attentive waiter. I will never stop coming to the restaurant every time I'm in town.

3aOksm_wF4XJ5jgHlynhNQ.text: Really awesome food! Excellent service. Good deals. Went downtown to walk around stopped in to eat and had great experience. Definitely a place we'd go back again and tell everyone about !

Fv2uLHUVWZY6I6flD4Twjg.text: My wife and I have been going to Casa Don Juan for years and it is superb. We especially enjoy the lunch specials, which are an excellent value. The tamales are also quite tasty. Perhaps our favorite item is the soup that is an option with every entree. Regardless of location the food is consistently delicious and the staff is always friendly and quite helpful. Do yourself a favor and check out this Vegas gem.

-DsJ8xTYhM9aSjrTMCCtkA.text: Love this place downtown. Great Mexican food, great authentic feel in decor. Food is super food. Just went with a Groupon for lunch entrees. Service was good & efficient. Tried cheese enchiladas & carne asada taco with beans. Friend had 2 tacos plate with rice & beans. Both awesome! Chips & salsa to start are complimentary & yummy!

Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef &amp; chicken taco. Delicious!

TeZ_zh1RkTJlA5FXQWLr0Q.text: 2nd time around, it's been a few years, or as you young hipsters say (it's been a minute). Place got renovated a little nicer, but the food is still excellent. Take a chance and get your arse out of the casino. This ain't your overpriced hussongs cantinas. Better food better price point. It's a win win. Afterwards you can go a few blocks south to Fremont street and try your luck there.

jiy1cAAQlFzLAwhY_Ex7SQ.text: Got the fajitas special. Said comes with soup or salad.  It didn't.  Took forever.   This place has really gone downhill. Service was crap.  I want my tip back.   Also couldn't find my waiter to ask for anything.  What fajitas only come with meat and tortillas???

jzDU5fFc1kvKGEUbv-PfXg.text: Good service. Food is "ok" BUT what really surprised us is that they charge for the salsa if you ask for ir. No advise at all.  Close to 2.00 per the "salsa roja" and almost 3.00 for the habanero. How this can happen on a Mexican Food Restaurant?

FYkcaWrXYkERqyyrWgtekg.text: Whew. Antiquing makes u thirsty. Couple o beers later... then shared Nachos... a bathroom.... what more can u ask! Food coma..! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omg eating our way Thru Vegas

6zK9bPfRaNrqpnxZ795l7g.text: Gregorio is the homeboy that will make your wildest dreams come True. He does his best to make your experience here a mucho success. Thanks Gregorio y amigos

bDB3zk6-lOse1UX0LiDPJg.text: I love this place when I am in the downtown Vegas area. Great selection of Mexican food. You gotta try their strawberry margaritas! Dining in is comfy and the portions are a nice size. Prices are reasonable too. Very friendly staff but due to their crowds; sometimes they can be a lil slow but not too bad. I eat here every time I visit Vegas. And oh; their desserts are awesome too. Get some to go and thank me later!

adQQAsHUbdROCaEHqZY8qQ.text: We've been looking for a great Mexican restaurant since moving to Vegas 2 years ago After many failures this restaurant is everything we hoped for and more Awesome happy hour food and drink prices are out of this world!!!!! Thanks to the awesome servers and bartenders see ya in October!!!

VUQLo44vUL3bYS6uWvOMcg.text: I am a 40 year Las Vegas resident. I have patronized this location and the one on East Sunset Rd many times. I went to this location tonight with my husband and an old friend. Our experience couldn't have been much worse.  The waiter neglected us to cater to larger parties. We had to ask for a second round of drinks. I had ordered extra salsa and napkins that never came. At the end of the dinner l accidentally spilled my drink all over the table. Not only did they NOT come to the table with a wet rag to wipe it, my husband had to get up and get napkins himself to clean it up. I had to ask for the drink to be replaced.  The Sunset location is so far from this horrible lack of service!!  The staff there is phenomenal. We are treated so well there that to experience what we did tonight is unreal. I cannot recommend this location even though l know this review will make little difference as this city is growing with visitors. All l can say is if you are a local, go to the Sunset location. You won't be disappointed.

HkeEwpIsT3aJwG-udOX_Yg.text: Maybe not the best food or service or atmosphere but something about it makes me love this place.   Don't expect a lot but if your in Vegas and want something off the strip that isn't too touristy but still fun, with mediocre food and drinks that are okay, I found your spot.   Tip: watch out for birthday parties, they will destroy your vibe, unless it's your birthday then they will make your vibe.

frUO1D_IzTfsuSiUbTySIA.text: Love this Art District area Casa Don Juan is located in.  Lots of bars, antique store & eclectic places.    Walked in to this very cute busy Mexican restaurant & were immediately seated.  On the left of the door is a refrigerated selection of mouthwatering cakes.  Yum!  Ordered Margaritas w/ salt which were good & strong so the chips, beans & salsa went well.  Split the Steak Fajitas & Shrimp/Chicken Fajitas w/ corn tortillas which were larger than usual ones that are for street tacos.  It was all delicious!  They also have a side of habanero sauce which wasn't too spicy & good.  I like hot sauces.    I highly recommend this spot & look forward to trying much more.

Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Fajitas 5Star
Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Chicken Fajitas w/ Corn Tortillas 5stars

GUUGkF5opPceRCuBPafu1Q.text: Update: very disappointed my wife and I was finishing leftovers the next day and she found a rock in her burrito  My wife has been wanting to try this place for a long time. The restaurant was bigger than I expected. Side note they have free parking in the back. My wife ordered a lemon drop margarita, I had long beach both $7.99/each. They gave us complimentary chips, salsa and refried beans dips. Very good and authentic taste. My wife ordered a Super Wet Burrito and ordered the chicken Chimichainsidengas. She enjoyed her food. Mine was good too but I would prefer some kind of salsa or sauce in the of the shell. Our waiter was nice and attentive but we never got his name. Our receipt says Raul. The bill came out to a total of $50. I wish I knew about the Groupon which comes with 2 entrees and 2 margaritas for $27

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My wife found a rock in her food the next day finishing her left overs
Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary chips, salsa and refried beans
Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Chimichangas with rice, refried beans, guacamole and sour cream $15.99

KCdyym3k0rX1THZ6AeGE7g.text: We have been coming to Casa Don Juan for over 10 years and have had some wonderful memories with friends, family over great drinks and food.  This time we decided to bring our 4 kids for the first time. We got seated immediately and served their delicious chips, salsa and bean dip.   Our server was a tall guy named Christian. He did not introduce himself he just quickly took our orders. No big deal, we understand how hectic and busy it can get on a sunday.  The problem started when the waiter got our order incorrect. Once the food came out my son and husbands order was incorrect.The rest of the orders were correct.   My son ordered a double cheese burger but when the order arrived he got a single patty burger. No big deal,  they put another order for another patty.   My husband ordered a chicken taco and chicken enchilada meal. When he got his dish he noticed he had a chicken taco and beef enchilada. He called the waiter back and told him his order was incorrect as he ordered all chicken not beef.   The waiter said, "isn't that chicken?" with an attitude and snatched the plate of the table and stormed out of our view all while my 4 kids witnessed his awful attitude.  Again, we kept our cool because of our kids.  About 10-15 minutes later my son's burger patty and husbands food comes out. By this time everyone else was done eating.  By this time my son's burger was cold My husband picked up his chicken taco and it was so wet it opened up from the bottom. Was it from sitting on the dish for a while? We will never know?  Again, my husband called the waiter and told him the food was not acceptable. The waiter coped an attitude and my husband asked to speak to the manager.  The manager Alberto came to our table, he listened to our concerns and apologized about Christian's attitude and mannerisms and waived my son's and husbands plate off the bill.   The server brought out our bill and my husband noticed the bill did not reflect what the manager stated. He called the waiter and explained what the manager had promised. The server snatches the bill crumbles it by my ear and storms away. By this time I feel embarrassed that my kids had to witness this and we walked away from the table. I feel sorry for the server because he is apparently having a bad day and it's  affecting the way he performs.   Yeap that's right I was not upset after leaving I simply explained to my kids that this is not how anyone should be treated and that if you pay for a service you should not settle for less.   Unfortunately, this is not the experience we expected and as a result we won't be returning again.  I hope management understands how good food and good costumer service goes hand in hand.

HDyLui96vV39t4Xqdow44w.text: This restaurant was recommended by a friend of a friend, so we went here to eat dinner. We waited for the rest of our large party to arrive before we were seated in the back. The waiter was pretty amazing, super attentive, and we got our drinks and food pretty quickly. In fact, we had a few waiters come by to refill our glasses of water, which is always a bonus for me because I drink a lot of water when I eat.  I ordered #6 with one chicken taco and one beef taco, both with a soft shell instead of hard. Both tacos were delicious and the plate was huge. With the rice and beans, I struggled to finish everything. I also order a margarita that was delicious.  At the end of dinner, the waiters had no problems splitting our checks into 7 checks.  Great food, friendly and awesome wait staff, and the price wasn't too bad for the size. The only thing that was annoying was trying to find parking, but that's just the nature of downtown. I'm glad we came here to eat!

6k_O9Th-k8U0-jQ1B0wcSw.text: Sharing this with the world because I think it needs to be said. I've been coming to CDJ for many years and I don't remember EVER paying 30%+ of a lunch bill for guac, queso, and a side of salsa. Quality of food is still amazing. However, for a small 6oz bowl of guac to be $12.99 is completely ridiculous. Will not be back. Can't blame the Chinese tariffs on this

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UfO1HoLY0YLVLDycoTv1AA.text: This place was Amazing!!! I was dying for some actual "good" food after paying ridiculous prices for mediocre food on the strip. We googled "best authentic Mexican food in Vegas" and this place was one of the top results, so we figured wth, it couldn't be worse than what we've been eating. Boy am I glad we rolled the dice and ventured away from the casinos!  Chips and (tasty) salsa were served before the meal for free... how it should be in every Mexican restaurant. The prices were extremely reasonable. The food was served hot and delicious. The staff was clean and unbelievably attentive. Definitely worth the trip. :D  This would have been a 5 star review, however I docked a star for the picture pressure. (It would have only been half a star, if I could.) Towards the end of the meal, a guy came to our table and offered a picture of us all "on the house." I would have turned it down, but figured if it was free, no harm no fowl. But when he came back with his "free" picture, he had two more bigger photos (5x7s) in a paper frame that he offered $20 for one and $25 for both. Being caught off guard by the promise of "free photographs," I felt a little pressured and obligated to buy them at that point. If there's a next time, I will know to turn down the free picture ahead of time. I have a camera on my iPhone that's legitimately "free." Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My son enjoying his burrito
Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The family photo that we paid $20 for. Lol
Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband loving his dinner

d8fP-IpaMiNDiB2nh-5swg.text: I have been coming to this place about 4 to 5 times a year. This is my go to spot when I have friends or family in town. I view it as authentic...the building is cool from the outside, and the inside is filled with bright colors. If you go into the main dining room you will see employees making the soft tortillas. Has a nice touch. Today I brought a special friend of mine here for lunch. We were greeted promptly and taken to our table by the bar area. The manager asked if we wanted the chips and guacamole, and informed me it was at market price. I understood and appreciated that information, and also understand how good the guacamole is here. :)  They brought out the chips, guacamole, and other spicy dips. I had to tell my friend not to eat one of the dips until we got our water. After a few minutes, the waiter took our order and we finally got our drinks. I always get the enchiladas with rice and my friend had her entree and wanted both sides beans. They brought out rice, was waiting for the waiter to check on us, but didnt after we recieved our food. To his credit, I think he had too big of a section. After about 10 minutes, I got up from the table and asked for her beans. 5 minutes later they brought them out. The food quality for my dish was excellent. I like the way the rice compliments the red sauce. The shredded beef was cooked well, and the guacamole was better than ever. All in all, my friend liked the place. I was on the fence between 3 and 4 stars. Gave it 4 for good past experiences. Today they fell a little short. Hopefully those kinks will be worked out before I dine here again. Ps please shorten down the birthday presentation

Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips and guacamole

V3iU-jys98zOPJzWv6JBAA.text: Always enjoyed the Frida Kahlo admiration.    The place has great atmosphere.   Food is good and drinks are enjoyable.   Have tried many different dishes.  They are always very good.   Recently had the fajitas which were flavorful.   It is not a 5 star amazing food place, but it's a great place to have Mexican if your close to downtown Las Vegas.

s7Y6JNM8K6VroVi_GOV65w.text: The service was excellent. The food was authentic. I had the #11 - 3 enchiladas (2 pollo, 1 Asada) arroz y frioles con mucho queso and a mix of the red and green sauce. The chicken was juicy and the beef was tender. My plate was brought to me exactly how I ordered it. I will admit to stuffing myself with every bite finishing my plate. I also ordered a mango margarita blended. It was so refreshing and tasty. Not too much alcohol that you couldn't taste the mango.

Photo of Casa Don Juan  - Downtown - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Margarita

L5FrricAj_1KzQqrSuQAtg.text: We had dinner tonight and the food was really good.  Everything came out got and fresh.  Good portions.  The service was ok.  We had to ask for refills and extra chips.  Also we ordered guacamole and it was $12.99 and they probably used 2 avocados! That literally blew my mind.  I would never order that again especially since avocados are 2 for $3 at Vons

NxKw-aL8C607YckDC_7JhQ.text: This gem had been recommended to me by numerous people and I finally made it in for lunch today. The place has a ton of character. Looks like it has been there for a long time, but without looking dingy or worn out at all.   I sat at a table in the bar area by myself. I intended to sit at the bar, but every place has slot machines in LV so it is hard to eat at the actual bar.   The service was friendly, attentive, fast and accurate. And I was the only fool sitting in the bar so the prompt attention was a welcome surprise.   The carnitas burrito I had with red sauce on it was not only legit, but huge. I could barely finish it. Very tasty. Tons of meat. A deal at $12. Would order it again in a second. I barely had enough room to munch on the chips, salsa and warm bean dip they brought. A couple cheap Negra Modelo drafts and it was a great meal at a great price.   I will be back.

5wVXIDd8MeEiTj8g8HR7Og.text: When is a good time for Mexican Food, how about everyday! This is a rhetorical question, as you have noti  Viva Margaritas and enchiladas. One margarita, two margaritas with Tequila and it's a fiesta time!   It's updating time, let's take a minute to step back in history. A long time ago, in a far off place called Las Vegas; a boy loved Mexican food so much that his veins probably contained salsa and tequila. A girl whom loved him very much encountered a place where that boy could enjoy his favorite food and drinks all the time. This is pre Yelp for me, but seven months ago I was lost and did not know how to use my strange new electronic tool. Yelp I turned too in the dark days when my beloved boy was taken from me by strange disturbances in the universe. Wanting to be close to him I was only able to eat here twice after his death. Now into the bold new future I find a new frontier ahead and we are rewriting the past with new memories.   Today I am stepping into the future, with empty pages hope lights my path to new discovery's! Pulling the massive doors of the casa we step back into the past it seems. The restaurant is so authentic that Spanish is the first language of most of the fantastic staff. While they speak and can understand most English it does not bother me! The traditional Mexican style food is what I come for, but appreciate the authenticity. We were seated immediately. The feel of this restaurant on the inside is tremendous. The history from the past haunts the walls but the memories that adorn the walls are tokens that we get to see from that living history from so long ago.   As the server came by it was time for drinks, and she straight ahead handed me a drink menu. It's funny that this was the first menu that I was handed too. The server explained to me first off the margarita specials. That sounded great anyways as my mouth was ready to taste that salt around the lip of the glass. Mexican food is best with margaritas, anyways! I wanted the server to bring me the drink and stop explaining all of the drink specials. Just continued to nod; and a while later a drink was placed in front of me. Finally I have that bitter taste of the salt and the fresh shaken concoction that is a top shelf margarita.   Now onto the food: the menu is extensive and they offer daily specials for lunch and dinner. With so much to choose from I needed a minute. The menu is put together extremely well. The choices are marked and clear to read. One can easily figure out what variations are offered for this choice or that one. As I raised my hand and closed the menu, the server came over. I went with the tamales which comes with rice and beans. With so many tamale choice I took the cheese and pork tamale. My twins spilt a plate of cheese enchiladas. Their plate came with rice and beans too.   While enjoying the complimentary chips and salsa my margarita was now less than half full. Our water cups are almost empty too. It's that spicy salsa that makes us want to cool down our taste buds. Our server is truly fantastic she filled our water glasses and our plates were put in front of us at the same time. I must of waved my hand over the margarita properly to send a secret signal that I wanted another to the server. As I was opening the tamale my margarita appeared in front of me. Yeah, that's great service. That cheese tamale was filled with white cheese and jalapenos ooh was it good. It tasted even better with sips of the margarita. The rice and beans here are always delicious. While eating the rice and beans you take your fork and put it in the beans first, then put rice on the fork and enjoy it together as a bean and rice union.   The food here is phenomenal and oh so delicious, as one has noticed I'm sure! The tamales took my taste buds on a roller coaster, especially the cheese one. The pork tamale was so yummy with the tamale so full of pork that with each cut of the fork on that tamale pork was included with the corn mix. Out of the two tamales the cheese was the best. Don't get me started on how ridiculously exceptional the cheese enchiladas were. Taking the fork and cutting into that cheese and red saucy mix, pulling the fork up as the cheese hangs down from the fork. You need to lean in for these cheese enchiladas bites, as to not leave any on your clothes for later. So now why are you still sitting there?  Margaritas check, best cheese enchiladas check, authentic atmosphere check. One cannot go wrong with all the positive things they have to offer here. If you want a wonderful place to have lunch with delicious food look no further. With new pages written for me and mine it's time to close this chapter until the next. Cheers to those that have fallen we raise a margarita in their honor. Cheers to exceptional food and drinks!

GtLPOYJulaQpMw13jXWDdQ.text: 70-18  Travel over to old Vegas to find this spot. You will not be disappointed!!!!  Authentic Mexican restaurant with a great atmosphere from the time you enter.   We had the chips and salsa to start as well as Queso Blanca. Note you have to ask for the habanero salsa.....very hot and tasty. They also have a cool bean dip.   They make in-house tortillas and various tamales all day. Very tasty!!!  We had the wet chicken burrito with all the trimmings. Again, nice presentation and tasty.  They have a full bar and all types of Margaritas as well as homemade desserts.   Prices were reasonable and portions were large. Bring your appetite and give this place a try.   We definitely will go back!!!

She said yes and that people don't really order fries. Umm but it's on your menu? I found it weird and funny at the same time. If you're going to sell fries, price your mediocre fries accordingly. End rant. Can i suggest a price of $1.50-$2.00?  4/30/19 UPDATE: Checked my debit card statement and they overcharged me by $2.00. How can this be when it was carry-out, total came out to $12.xx? Spoke to Juliano (manager), he said he'll get back to me by Thursday. He said the only way this could happen is if they added tip. The plot thickens...   I had a really nice dinner here about a year ago, i'm not sure if I would even come back now.  5/2/19 UPDATE: Still no call from the manager.... If you eat here your card statements. Will be calling my bank soon. Im not mad at the $2 its the principle. It was carry out...  I wasn't waited on or anything, and they have no right to ADD tip themselves.

cW9r4tMgCoK53CNguTl2tA.text: Had a team lunch at Casa Don Juan to celebrate couple people birthday. We had about 15 people. The restaurant was pretty packed when we got there and fortunately we had reservation.  Things I liked: - The salsa was pretty good with a nice touch of spiciness. -Fried Tilapia(Mojarra Frita). The fish was very crispy outside which I like but it was slightly overcooked. The meat is not dry but could be moister. The rice and bean were fine. -The service was good. They all work together well, water and chip got refilled promptly. And the servers were friendly and energetic. -It was pretty cool that there were tons of Frida portraits hanged on the wall as decoration.  It was a good lunch and I have no problem to come back again.

B8R93CvxUE7pEN4l-mTDsA.text: My first and last experience at Casa Don Juan had to have been one of the absolute worst restaurant experiences I have ever had.   The overall atmosphere of the restaurant is unaccommodating and unwelcoming, and the staff treats you like trash if you ask for the simplest things. On top of their already overpriced dishes, charging $1.50 for a small spoonful of sour cream and accusing their customers of LYING when they receive the wrong order leads me to believe that the restaurant honestly doesn't care about their customers, and they are only out to leech money from them.   It would be much more worth your time and experience going to another fine Mexican restaurant in town like Bonito Michoacan on Decatur than to be harassed and provided with the lousy service at Casa Con Juan. It's a shame, really.

dhVDVkXkFHNlc0qLX-IqQw.text: Incredible huevos con chorizo. The meat is spiced just right and ratio of eggs to meat is perfect. Homemade corn and flour tortillas!!  Excellent rice and beans. The salsa and bean dip served with chips as you sit down are also outstanding. The service is friendly and fast. Great breakfast!!

M1Ieigw1ETmBiZ5lrY-UBA.text: Didn't even get water before they told us that their machines were down and could only take cash, how about telling us that when we walked in before you say us. Very unapologetic about it & we were starved.  Not sure it's a ploy to use their ATM but we don't pay $5 to get cash. I'm sure their food is great but service is lacking.

IAEoLQ7Y_lrH-dKiU7KXZw.text: My friends and I (a party of about 9) went for dinner last night and experienced a few things.  * There's very limited parking. The parking they do have is unlit and in a bad area of town. Definitely thought my car was going to get broken into because I had to park in a dark alley.  * Waitstaff is more than a little pushy. Especially the guy that walks around trying to sell you an overpriced photo he took of your party. Not hospitable at all.  * Portions were generous, but the food was mediocre. Our waiter even said that Lindo Michoacan had better food.  * 3 of the members of my party wanted more sauce to put on their burritos and tamales. The server brought out 3 portions of green sauce, but failed to inform us that sides of sauce were $3 EACH. When I saw an extra $9 added to our bill, I politely asked if they could remove the charge. I was told that wasn't possible so politely asked to talk to a manager. She also told us that it wasn't possible to take the charge off, even though we weren't notified when we ordered.   For putting the business ahead of their customer, Casa Don Juan has lost a customer.

XjXAkuCC0r9DW2Sh7x5rSQ.text: We went to Mundo tonight only to find it's not open on Mondays.  Duh to me for not checking hours in advance.  Plan B - go to Casa Don Juan.  We had two very enjoyable meals.  My gringa wife had a plain chicken breast with refried beans.  I had the chicken in mole.  Both were good.  My mole sauce was very flavorful.  It was rich with diverse elements that made it a complex and very tasty dish.  While there, a nice gentleman played guitar and sang including Speedy Gonzales.  It was a good meal and a fun evening.  I can't wait to go back to try the tongue tacos.

2Ue9i6rpmR7bJ2ayUU-CTg.text: I was teetering between 3 and 4 stars, but the price is what sealed the deal for me to round down on this place.  If you find yourself in DTLV needing a quick bite to eat, Casa Don Juan will totally do it for you. This isn't authentic Mexican food; it's the super-fast Mexican-American style restaurant that can be found across the country. You know what I'm talking about -- the food tastes exactly how you think it will. And this isn't a slam at all -- sometimes I crave that stuff!  One thing to note that you can't find at every other Mexican place: handmade tamales! And they are delicious! Other things we tried were margaritas, queso, tacos, and beans and rice... all were totally fine. The service was super fast and friendly too.   I did think the price was a bit too high for such fast-style Mexican food. Then again, this is Vegas, so I shouldn't have been so surprised.

lMrMSr5xkgPPZRSMxy7K1A.text: The chips and salsa are the best I've had in Las Vegas.  The salsa is obviously homemade, very spicy and lots of fresh cilantro floating around in it.  I could have done without the bean dip.    I had a wet chicken burrito (I feel pervy just typing that).  The burrito was pretty huge and the green sauce had a very spicy kick.  Well worth the $7.99 price tag.  I had so much chips and salsa that the burrito had to go back to the office with me.   Service was great.  Everyone is very friendly and a couple of different servers checked in on us.  Parking was crazy because apparently everyone downtown eats lunch here at noon.  Thankfully, there is plenty of street parking.  Just bring a couple of quarters in case you have to use a meter.

01OrNW5poVfFO3jAIZdUZQ.text: Over Thanksgiving weekend, we walked the Arts District and thought we would try Casa Don Juan for lunch.  The food and drink were absolutely exceptional, making us embarrassed to have been here for many years and not tried it previously.  It was so enjoyable that prior to a Smith Center show this past Sunday, we took friends to share in the experience.  It could not have been more different than the previous visit.  The Patron margaritas were not nearly as good as before (tasted watered down) and two of four food orders were incorrect.  They really have to work on consistency.  As a result, not certain if we will have a return visit.

kWqZJuwgn7nC3kMfntZPpw.text: One of the few good restaurants in the Arts District. Have come here several times, and every time the food is wonderful, the drinks good, the service friendly, and the place gets more crowded than you'd think for Main St. They never gripe or charge for extra chips & salsa, and it's walkable from First Friday.   Came here with a large party and they could only split the bill in thirds, which would have been fine, had they kept it clean. Instead drinks from one table got put on another table's bill and it was a bit of a mess. Fortunately everything worked out easily. With a cranky office crew, that could have been a mess.  Has a small parking lot behind the building. Street parking also available.

N6xZMsY7LxNcKJRSfj3jPA.text: We ordered cheese dip as soon as we sat down. By time it arrived we still hadn't seen our server, had to ask bus person for water. We were almost finished with cheese dip when our server finally arrived. We probably waited 10 minutes for someone to greet us, when he did he seemed rushed, I think he was in a different part of the restaurant. When we ordered drinks he had a tough time understanding the wine I wanted  "Chardonnay" so I pointed to menu. I told him we had a groupon upfront incase they wanted to see it first as some places do. I knew the Fajitas #24 were enough for two so I told him we were going to split it. He proceeds to tell us NO you can't do that you have to have two entrees!! (Yes I knew we had to spend $37.50 to use the groupon). Ok we will order another dish. BF ordered Cam Mojo de Ajo, shrimp cooked in garlic. Food arrived quickly. Our drinks are almost gone by now.  My Fajitas had absolutely no flavor what-so-ever, the chicken was very dry. Very disappointed as my girlfriend had them before and they were delish! The #24 shrimp dish was served with shells and legs still on. The garlic seemed like the jarred type, not fresh. Plus normally sauteed shrimp isn't cooked with shells on. It was overpowering with garlic. Drinks empty now. Stick with water. We saw our waiter 3 far and between times. When he gave us check it put it on the table and left. After waiting to pay him, we took it to the front. Would have been nice had he told us!  Not going back.

The only complaint some might have is parking, as it is free but limited spaces nearby... but I can walk from my office ;)  They have daily specials served with soup. I love the tacos, enchiladas, tamales, and chicken fajitas. We always ask for our favorite server Ivan, but the whole staff take great care of us when we are in. We ordered drinks and food from they late night specials menu, food was good, not amazing but good, it was also closing time so who knows... And around $6-$8 a plate. The beverages were really fun, one came in a bowl and it had like 5 types of alcohol in it and it was delish!   The service was great, drinks were kept full and table cleared off frequently of empty glasses. Friendly staff and comfy booths.   I'd go back for sure! They have a bar in there also that has some tv screens and the restaurant section is a pretty good size.   Cool decor and fun vibe. Decent food. I will have to go back and eat when they are not closing. But I had the Pollo Mole and it was very good.

18-pMZyseUvVLbocLo0Jjg.text: I had been urged to come here several times by friends, for whom this is their go-to place for a Mexican food fix.  Finally, they simply took me here.  I didn't know what to expect in a remote area of town that was previously unknown to me.  I just ordered my favorites, and let the chips fall where they landed.  In this case an abundance of warm tortilla chips freshly made in house landed on my table in a woven basket, along with hot sauce and a bean dip, just after I had sat down--on a super-hard, wooden seat.  The chips and dipping alternatives were welcome sights for this hungry diner.  Soon two orders of guacamole joined this array, and I quickly forgot about my hard seat.    The homemade guacamole was cool and creamy, but it still retained a few small lumps and tiny pieces of tomato.  If it contained any sour cream, it was not enough for me to notice.  The hot sauce was good and tasty, with medium-level spiciness.  The bean dip, slightly salty, was mild and addictive.  The chip basket was emptying fast, as one after the other worked their way to my mouth.  Service was excellent, as my water and Sprite were replenished without request, and I was even asked to hand over used paper napkins during the course of dining, so new ones could be immediately supplied.  I don't know if this was the regular level of service or influenced by my photo and note taking inside the restaurant.  But it was stellar service.  I ordered a Burrito Mojado, a wet carnitas burrito covered with Enchilada Sauce and a smattering of guacamole, that I suspected would be too large for me to finish in one sitting.  And I was right--especially because I ordered it with an a la carte Shredded Beef Taco.  The burrito, which was filled with carnitas, beans, and rice, was a bit salty but otherwise tasted great.  The Enchilada Sauce over melted cheese was mild, which is what I prefer.  I ate and enjoyed a little over half of the gigantic burrito that arrived before me, and packaged the remainder for a follow-up lunch.      The taco in a springy, mostly hard corn tortilla, as ordered, tasted good, but I was quite disappointed that, although it contained adequate amounts of shredded beef, lettuce, and shredded cheese, this taco was sans tomato.  I often pay extra to make sure that I get tomatoes in my tacos, but this time decided that I would just eat what was presented to me as is.  I was surprised that the taco tasted as good as it did while lacking tomatoes, but still would have preferred some cool, red vegetation in that taco.    Non-Mexican fare did not fare that well on this outing.  Diane's ordered Cheeseburger ran into serious trouble.  In two tries at medium-rare, the kitchen first produced a patty that was beyond well done, and then another that was simply well done.  And the forlorn patties each looked to be no thicker than 1/8 of a pound.  The restaurant had a display case that contained a Chocolate Cake, Red Velvet Cake, Carrot Cake, Cheesecake, and Lemon Cake that all looked pretty good.  So, I ordered a slice of Lemon Cake for sharing.  And, it was cold, imbued with the flavor of lemon, and pretty darn good!  Casa Don Juan has a nice, festive atmosphere with some interesting touches, like several pictures and photos of Mexican artist Frida Kahlo on a dedicated wall.  This is Old Las Vegas, South of the Border style.  And, based on what I ate and experienced here, I intend to return.

u7Efz5lGvRv5Xw5RwbNB_Q.text: Authentic Mexican food!  Busy Mothers Day lunch was perfect.  Carnitas was excellent and  the green herb drink I ordered was fantastic.  My wife and I enjoyed the atmosphere, food and outstanding service  from Javier!

Ivan is an amazing server and can't wait to come back for him to serve us again! My 9 year old is OBSESSED  with the refried beans!!!!!  Thank Casa Don Juan for staying consistent and giving us the reassurance to know every time we stop in we get the great quality service and food that we always know is here!

fVJIy0NOEFZDdKkQKb9MyA.text: I used to live in Vegas and this would be my go to spot for Mexican food (I am originally from southern California) every paycheck. Since I moved away 5 years ago I wasn't sure if this place was still around. Saw a groupon available for my old spot and had to take it! Not a very busy rush we waited a long time to order but our server did not check on us once even after our food was served to ask if everything was ok . We had to call someone to get us a refill and the lady sitting one table behind us was looking for the server too so she can put her order in . Luego  que andaba peliando los meceros contra  cocineros que le pida bien el pendo o mandalo ala verga esas fueron sus palabras. Ta bien si dejo propinas.

3hwTJkxrWmXGJJ1r4UPSJw.text: Came here with my husband on a Friday morning 4/4/14  The place was easy to find from the strip ,love the Mexican feel and look.  it was pretty empty fast service and very friendly waiter he was really attentive to what we needed. the bean dip and salsa are really good I shared a tostada de camaron with my husband that was delish, i got a plate of camarones a la diabla a good amount of spicy if you dont eat spicy food i dont recommend My husband got caldo de camaron he loved it i had a taste very flavorful . We also got hand made tortillas that were great reminded me of my grandmas cooking i def recommend but is a little pricey but for the great service and food its a steal

ggt3C9mu9GFoHETY8Lei6A.text: We came here for my grandma's birthday dinner and just like the rating says - meh, I've experienced better. I ordered a michelada and it was pretty bad; watered down. It was as if they took cheap tomato paste, a pinch of salt, and mixed it with a gallon of water. And it had BEER in it. Still tasted very watered down. I love micheladas but I didn't even get half way through this one. The food was okay but the process of the bill was beyond frustrating. I ordered just a burrito - it was a mix of meat and shrimp and I believe it was $13. I was asked if I would like a side of guacamole with it. I said sure. When my food came out it was covered in a sauce and had MAYBE a teaspoon of guacamole, which was run down and kind of brown LOL. I proceeded to eat half of it anyway, thinking they just threw in something extra. When I get the check, I got charged $18. Why? Because the sauce and "side" of guacamole. There is a burrito for that price - a full shrimp burrito, which I did not get, but had I known I was going to be charged that price, I would've ordered that. The least they could have done was tell me that I was going to get a $5 up-charge for the laughable sauce and drop of guacamole lol. Then, when we were getting ready to pay, I noticed my mom added a tip on top of the tip we were already charged for being such a large party. When I told her to remove it the cashier rolled her eyes at me. I will GLADLY stick to Lindo Michoacan.

pf-aQAPzDE1Uu7qw7GEgLA.text: My boyfriend and I visited on 12/29/16. We were immediately greeted and seated. Ivan was our server and he was totally awesome! He accomodated us in every way and recommended new things . Joel brought us our drinks and refilled our chips at least 4 times! Thanks Joel!! My boyfriend had the pork con chile verde, and it came with rice and beans and it was so darn good! I had a carnitas burrito enchilada style double rice ! And paired it with two margaritas! Pretty much everything you try here is spectacular! And the service is just a plus! We'll be back for sure

Had three people working our party of 20 and they seemed really overwhelmed. Food was okay but the service could stand an adjustment especially considering the tips they made off us.  We also had someone celebrating a birthday and they charged a $10.00 cake fee for bringing in our own cake.

NLUXwBOPv9qPeCiS5B1cBg.text: We found Casa Don Juan by accident looking for hangover food/drinks off of the Vegas strip.  We got very lucky landing here!  The chips/salsa/beans that come to the table free are so good, so was the bloody Mary and the pineapple pina colada.    It has great outdoor seating which we sat at to enjoy the sun, inside the restaurant was pretty cold at the time.  My sister had the chicken fajitas and the portion size was huge, and she loved them.  I had a platter with pork tamales YUM! a beef taco that was ok and a fried pablano pepper stuffed with cheese also very good.  We ate everything and it did help cure the hangover.  Definitely tasted like authentic Mexican you can only get on the West coast.

oNng5wUxTcYjxwVMcAgqcw.text: It had been about a year since we've been to Casa Don Juan.  We've been going there forever since my wife and I are residents since the early 70s. Did I mention the Margaritas? OMG so good.  We have a dinner group of about a dozen that are booking an event there in August and it will permanently be in our rotation. Nevertheless, we enjoyed our Mexican fare and pleasant surroundings of this dining establisment. I recommend coming here for a fun atmosphere and delicious eats if you're in the downtown area.

The chips, salsa and beans that come standard as soon as your seated are really good. The salsa is better than any salsa I can think of, and the beans are always hot and fresh and deliver real flavor. The tortillas are always fresh because they are hand made to order. Their breakfast menu is excellent and tamales are delightful!  The service is always good thanks to Jessica and the rest of the friendly staff!
